title: Update tools build gradle to Android Studio 3.0 Final
message: Update tools build gradle to Android Studio 3.0 Final

title: Add some explanations about the decision to use notifyDataSetChanged()
message:
Add some explanations about the decision to use notifyDataSetChanged()

As the number of items in the list is not big, it is simpler to rebind all data in order to reload the card image. Also, the code readability is better.

title: Add some comments about skipping an observable emission
message: Add some comments about skipping an observable emission

title: Avoid unnecessary emission of the refreshcardimages observable
message:
Avoid unnecessary emission of the refreshcardimages observable

When subscribing to the refreshcardimages observable, it was emitting an item. But it was not needed because at the time it is subscribed, the activity is being created which will load all the cards anyway.
So, skip the first emission to avoid loading the cards twice when starting the application.

title: Improve fix for issue #28
message:
Improve fix for issue #28

After changing cards listing update to send animated modifications with dispatchUpdatesTo(Adapter) in https://github.com/franciscojunior/Vampidroid/commit/fe3021291244e2b35a9fa2eeab3e180c5d7265c8 when the cards images folder is changed, this isn't reflected in the listing.
This is caused by the fact that the listing isn't refreshed anymore. And so, the images aren't reloaded. Now, when the folder is changed, force a full refresh so the images are reloaded from the new folder.
In order to do that, CardsViewModel now makes available an Observable (getNeedRefreshCardImages()) which emits whenever this folder is changed so the application can react accordingly.

The previous getNeedRefreshFlag Observable which was also used to emit whenever both the folder was changed and the preference for search inside the text card was changed was replaced by the getNeedRefreshCardsListing which only emits when the preference is changed and the cards listing needs to be refreshed. Not related to the images folder.

Add tests for those Observables

title: Initial Room support
message:
Initial Room support

Data was being access directly through SQLite API. Cursors were being used.
Now, Room API is being used and list of entities replace Cursors.

Dynamic queries still have its sql constructed by hand and sent through query()
Room method.

Now uses DiffUtil to dispatch list changes to recyclerview and get some nice
animations.

Clean up the code base to remove a lot of methods related to Database handling.

title: Add some custom transition to card details activity to remove flickering

Add some custom transition to card details activity to remove flickering

The issue is that the navigation bar is animated when the shared transition animation is used. In order to avoid that, we have to specify that the navigation bar shouldn't participate in the animation.

Reference: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/26600263/how-do-i-prevent-the-status-bar-and-navigation-bar-from-animating-during-an-acti

title: Fix memory leak caused by retained fragments
message:
Fix memory leak caused by retained fragments

The fragments of the viewpager were being retained which was causing memory leaks.

Those leaks were being created because the CardsListFragment, having its instance retained here, was acting like an "static" instance which is already demonstrated to be a source of such leaks.

title: Add new component PersistentSearchBar
message:
Add new component PersistentSearchBar

This component is responsible for handling the searchbar behavior, removing a lot of code from the main activity.

Replaced the searchbar internal component from MultiAutoCompleteTextView to a simple EditText.

title: Add CardFilters save and restore view state support
message:
Add CardFilters save and restore view state support

When rotating the device, the CardFilters wasn't restoring itself correctly because it was missing the track of how many filters have been applied.

Also, when this occured, the filter headers weren't being correctly tinted when a filter had been selected previously.

title: Filter only the list affected by the filtering option being selected by the user
message:
Filter only the list affected by the filtering option being selected by the user

Only the name filter will be applied to both lists. Other filters will be only applied to the specific list.

Performance is improved because the list which isn't affected by the filter isn't reloaded unnecessarily.

Also, the delay for processing filters is only applied to the card name filtering where we have to wait the user to stop typing before applying.

Fix #30

title: Fix a bug where an imageview could have a reference to a recycled bitmap
message:
Fix a bug where an imageview could have a reference to a recycled bitmap

If the cache was cleared (maybe because of a low memory situation) those imageviews will have references to BitmapDrawables which have references to recycled bitmaps. This happened when those BitmapDrawables were evicted from the cache.

In this case, clear the imageViews drawables (BitmapDrawable) references. This is needed because we are loading the bitmap drawables using asynctask in a backgrond thread. This means the UI thread may try to draw the imageViews (which have the recycled bitmap reference) before we can load the new BitmapDrawables crashing the application.

title: Load discipline images when resuming activity
message:
Load discipline images when resuming activity

This avoids problems in case the discipline images aren't available anymore when the activity is resumed. This can happen in low memory situations.

title: Add a small delay between filtering to remove pressure from UI thread
message:
Add a small delay between filtering to remove pressure from UI thread

When the user is filtering the card in the searchbox, instead of filtering cards after each new letter, we just filter after a small amount of time has passed (250ms). This way we don't waste resources making the filtering if the user is going to change it anyway.

 Also, this change removes pressure from the UI thread to run the animations more smoothly.

title: Fix searchbar layout problem when using API 10
message:
Fix searchbar layout problem when using API 10

When running on api 10, the drawer appears over the edittext instead of keeping on its left as usual. After setting the layout param to use all the width of the parent (MATCH_PARENT), the layout was being drawn correctly.

When adding the customview to the toolbar, although it is specified match_parent as the width, it seems that this is changed to wrap content. This is confirmed by using the layout inspector where you can see the layoutparam of wrap_content.

title: Changes to use CardFilters and BadgeView
message:
Changes to use CardFilters and BadgeView

Now CardFilters custom view is used which allows to remove a lot of responsibility from the main activity.

The filter icon view in the search bar had to be changed to accomodate the BadgeView.
 BadgeView adds a framelayout surrounding the view it adds a badge to. This was giving problems to the other views which used the filter icon to position themselves inside the layout. In this case, the filter cards imageview was surrounded by a framelayout. This way the other views in the layout could use this added framelayout to position themselves and thus, free the filter imageview to be manipulated by the BadgeView.

title: Fix problem when the recycled disciplines bitmaps were incorrectly being used.

Fix problem when the recycled disciplines bitmaps were incorrectly being used.

message:
Remove a line left there by mistake

 It was causing NPE when running on Android 4.4 and below.

title: Add support to cancel an image loading operation in progress when reusing the image view
message:
Add support to cancel an image loading operation in progress when reusing the image view

If the same imageview is being used to load an image and there is already an async task created to load a previous image, cancel that task before creating a new one.

 This is useful in the recyclerview scenario where the user may scroll the list pretty fast and the views get recycled. This way, there is no need to wait for the previous image load operation to finish.

When scrolling fast, this will avoid setting unnecessarily a image because it may have already passed past its position and it would be setting an image which will be overwritten by another one of the actual position.

title: Fix NRE when trying to select parent of root folder.
message:

Fix NRE when there are no folders on the selected folder.

Fixed a display error of the selected folder if the root folder was reached. It was displaying two root bars (//) instead of a single one.

message:
Fix Intent parameter names.

Without this fix, the library card image wasn't being loaded.

title: Improve card image loading
message:
Improve card image loading

Cards with accented chars names are properly recognized and loaded.

Improved Utils.loadCardImage to not be responsible to derivate the cardfilename. Now it accepts a filename instead. Also removed the decision making of which placeholder card (gold back or green back) to be shown in case the card isn't found. This decision is made by the caller and passed to loadCardImage as a resource id.

title: Improve card and disciplines image loading
message:
Improve card and disciplines image loading

Moved a lot of methods to Utils class.

Created an LRU cache of discipline images to avoid using too much memory loading all the discipline images at once.

Created an AsyncTask to load discipline images into the corresponding ImageViews.

message: Do not use main (UI) thread to load image

message:

title: Remove image sources from layout
message:
Remove image sources from layout

Replace them with tools namespace version so they appear only when editing the layout. This way, those images don't interfere with the running layout and there is no need to clear them at runtime.

title: Improve filters navigation drawer layout.
message:
Improve filters navigation drawer layout.

Change styles to better match layout specs.

title: Fix a problem with shared element transition
message:
Fix a problem with shared element transition

This layout uses imageviews in two rows. But they aren't always shown. When the last one isn't shown (it only appears if the card has 7 disciplines, which is very rare), the path of the transition animation is incorrectly computed and would result in a little bump when the transition finishes. By removing this last imageview from the layout, the transition is computed correctly as the layout stays with a stable size.

title: Improved Dialog response when directory contains a lot of files
message:
Improved Dialog response when directory contains a lot of files

Now the listing of directories is done in another thread to not block the UI thread. This improves touch response when the directory has a lot of files. As is the case when selecting the folder which contains the images since they are a lot.

Also implemented onSaveInstanceState to save the current being selected folder. This way it isn't lost on screen rotation or when the user changes to another app.

title: Add more optimizations to images loading.
message:
Add more optimizations to images loading.

setImageBitmap creates a new BitmapDrawable and calls setImageDrawable.
So, instead of using setImageBitmap, create the BitmapDrawable which
will be cached and call setImageDrawable directly.

This will reduce pressure in the GC by avoiding the creation of a lot
of BitmapDrawable objects when calling setImageBitmap a lot of times.

http://java.dzone.com/articles/android-listview-optimizations-0

which weren't updated.

title: Fix center alignment in the custom deck crypt and library listing view.
message:
Fix center alignment in the custom deck crypt and library listing view.

The number of cards weren't being center aligned vertically.
According to this issue report: https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=59368
there is a problem in the RelativeLayout on api 18+.
By overriding the RelativeLayout , a fix could be coded.
Thanks issue commenter who created the fix.

title: Add script to update database to Unaligned Expansion
message:
Add script to update database to Unaligned Expansion

This script updates the database keeping the same ids as the previous
database. New cards were added which change the ids of previous cards.
Existent decks and favorite cards may not point to the correct ids when
the database is updated. This script remaps ids which were changed to be
the same as they were in the previous database.

title: Improved filtering performance by using a timer to check when do filtering. Thisâ€¦
message: Improved filtering performance by using a timer to check when do filtering. This way, only after user has stopped typing we do a search. This makes typing filters more smooth and save resources by not doing so many queries while user is typing.
